abstract: The Congressional supercommittee dealing with the budget deficit is contemplating the notion that tax cuts will provoke growth and more revenue -- and that is a dangerous approach, an economist writes.
snippet: The Congressional supercommittee dealing with the budget deficit is contemplating the notion that tax cuts will provoke growth and more revenue -- and that is a dangerous approach, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson, the former chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, is the co-author of "13 Bankers."

headline.main: Can Tax Cuts Pay for Themselves?
